com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.transform.row

Class RowWiseDataTableTransformation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.transform.row.RowWiseDataTableTransformation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataTableTransformation, MutatingDataTableTransformation
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CompositeRowWiseDataTableTransformation, ContextualRowWiseTransformation

    public abstract class RowWiseDataTableTransformation
extends java.lang.Object
implements MutatingDataTableTransformation
    The RowWiseDataTableTransformation class is used to construct row-wise mutating data table transformations. Row-wise means that the transformation will be applied one row at a time, and, generally, implies that the transformation for each row is independent of the others (which, if true, means the process can easily be parallelized).

    • Method Detail

      • transformRow

        public abstract void transformRow(DataRow row,
                DataTable table,
                int rowIndex)
        Transform a given row of data in the table. The actual transformation should be performed on the table (at the specified row index), and not on the data row, which may be unmodifiable or separated view of the data. On the other hand, access of the row's data for use the transformation should occur through the data row parameter.
        Parameters:
        row - The DataRow representation of the row to transform.
        table - The table holding the row to transform.
        rowIndex - The index (in table of the row to transform.

        Returns:
        the input table, after it has been transformed.
